content: Taken all together, it’s not as if Clemson exposed a new formula for beating a Saban Alabama squad. It took the same ingredients we’d suspected all along: a mobile, transcendent quarterback playing the game of his life; an active defensive front capable of pressuring Hurts; and some extra moments of fortune created by both skill (see: all of Mike Williams’s sprawling catches) and luck (facing a reduced running game in the fourth quarter).
